etymologies: Middle English: from medieval Latin missale, neuter of ecclesiastical Latin missalis ‘relating to the Mass’, from missa ‘Mass’

definitions: a book containing the texts used in the Catholic Mass throughout the year

examples.text: the bookcase contained an assortment of old prayer books, missals, and devotional pamphlets
Christian influence on Viking art is demonstrated by the illuminated missals and gold reliquaries

shortDefinitions: book containing texts used in Catholic Mass throughout year
